qas.question: What kind of climate occurred in the Americas?
What disappeared during the Archaic period?
What became the norm for the mobile bands?
What did they rely less and less on?
What was there a pattern of in this period?
Which period in the Americas saw an unchanging environment?
The first appearance of the megafauna happened in what period?
A colder, more arid climate happened in what period?
The minority of population groups at this time were what?
Which groups started to focus on resources available to them globally?

context: <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>The Archaic period<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> in the Americas saw a changing environment featuring a <a0_0>warmer more arid<a0_0/> climate and the disappearance of the last <a1_0>megafauna<a1_0/>. The majority of population groups at this time were <b8_0>still highly mobile hunter-gatherers<b8_0/>; but now <b9_0>individual groups<b9_0/> started to focus on resources available to them locally, thus with the passage of time there is a pattern of <a4_0>increasing regional generalization<a4_0/> like, the Southwest, Arctic, Poverty, Dalton and Plano traditions. This <a2_0>regional adaptations<a2_0/> would become the norm, with reliance less on <a3_0>hunting and gathering<a3_0/>, with a more mixed economy of small game, fish, seasonally wild vegetables and harvested plant foods.
